qas.question: In what year did the network end American programming?
Which recent (2007-2008) shows helped the network regain popularity?

answers.text: Little Mosque on the Prairie and The Border

qas.question: What foreign programming is shown on the CBC after 1998?

answers.text: a handful of British programs, and a few American movies and off-network repeats

qas.question: What two private Canadian broadcasters did the CBC merge with?

plausible_answers.text: Little Mosque on the Prairie and The Border

qas.question: What were two controversial shows that lowered the ratings of the CBC?

plausible_answers.text: Canadian programs, a handful of British programs, and a few American movies and off-network repeats

qas.question: What type of programming is permitted to be broadcast in Canada?
For how long has the CBC maintained its lead over other broadcast networks?

context: Until <a0_0>1998<a0_0/>, the network carried a variety of American programs in addition to its core Canadian programming, directly competing with private Canadian broadcasters such as <b3_0>CTV and Global<b3_0/>. Since then, it has restricted itself to <b5_0>Canadian programs, <a2_0>a handful of British programs, and a few American movies and off-network repeats<b5_0/><a2_0/>. Since this change, the CBC has sometimes struggled to maintain ratings comparable to those it achieved before 1995, although it has seen somewhat of a ratings resurgence in recent years. In the 2007-08 season, hit series such as <a1_0><b4_0>Little Mosque on the Prairie and The Border<b4_0/><a1_0/> helped the network achieve its strongest ratings performance in over <b6_0>half a decade<b6_0/>.
